message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a novel approach to generate universal adversarial perturbations (UAPs) for EEG-based brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) using total loss minimization (TLM) technique. The paper discusses the vulnerability of convolutional neural network (CNN) classifiers to UAPs and proposes a method to generate UAPs for both target and non-target attacks. The paper also verifies the transferability of UAPs in EEG-based BCI systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision). The paper also discusses the security concerns of BCIs, which makes cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) a likely sub-category. Finally, since the paper proposes a novel approach to generate UAPs, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible sub-category.
